name: df-cfilu
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3
body: |- wceq(ccfilu, cmpt(s0, cuni(crn(cust)), crab(s1, cfv(cfbas, cdm(cuni(cv(s0)))), wral(s2, cv(s0), wrex(s3, cv(s1), wss(cxp(cv(s3), cv(s3)), cv(s2)))))))
bodyPretty: ⊢ CauFilU =(s0 ∈ ⋃ ran(UnifOn)↦ { s1 ∈(fBas ` dom(⋃ s0))| ∀(s2 ∈ s0, ∃(s3 ∈ s1,(s3 × s3)⊆ s2))})
comment: Define the set of Cauchy filter bases on a uniform space. A Cauchy filter base is a filter base on the set such that for every entourage ` v ` , there is an element ` a ` of the filter "small enough in ` v ` " i.e. such that every pair ` { x , y } ` of points in ` a ` is related by ` v ` ". Definition 2 of [BourbakiTop1] p. II.13. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 16-Nov-2017.)
